message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CVPR

The paper focuses on improving visual odometry for robot navigation tasks using convolutional neural networks. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) and robotics (cs.RO) sub-categories. The paper also proposes a novel architecture that combines absolute pose regression and optical flow, which involves machine learning techniques such as recurrent layers and pose estimation. This suggests that the paper may also fit under the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Finally, the paper presents experimental results on publicly available datasets and an industry dataset, which indicates that it may also be relevant to the computer vision and pattern recognition (cs.CVPR) sub-category.
